1.content: You just got a job as a door to door salesperson selling an amazing product. What do you sell?
1.title: New Job

choices: It contains only good news
It is written an edited by aliens or fairyfolk
It gives each individual reader news about their family
The pictures give an extra-sensory effect - you see, hear and smell
Your choice
11.content:
"Here you go, lady, a special sample of our newest newspaper!"

"Hmmmmm ... what's special about it? I like my regular newspaper, actually."

"Aha, lady, that's where we're different."

"Everyone says they're different. Well, go on, tell me, how is your newspaper different?"

"Here you go, lady, read the headlines. Read the whole first page, if you like."

So, the lady reads. She's a bit skeptical at first, but slowly, her face takes on a look of wonder. You smile. You've seen that look before - just a minute ago next door, actually, and just a little before that two doors away ... in fact, everyone on the street has now subscribed to your marvelous newspaper.

How could anyone resist it?
11.title: Newspapers

choices: His Mother's house who he hasn't seen in 10 years
A house he saw in a dream
A famous celebrity's house
111.content:
"This is so fresh , it takes your mind off all the bad things in the world"

"I'm glad you like it mam, would you like to subscribe?"

"Would I? I would pay millions of dollars for content like this"

"Hahaha im glad you think it's worth that much. How about I'll charge you 10 buck a year?"

"Well that sounds great! Where do I sign?"

"Right here Mam"

He hands her a sheet to sign and walks away casually with another 10 bucks.

He thinks how wonderfull it is to work outside in the fresh air, meet exicting new people , and get paid to do it! He must have the best job in the world!

The salesman comes up to the next house, it looks strangely familar. Then the thought comes back to him.

This is.....
111.title: It contains only good news

choices: Knock on the door.
Move on to the next house.
1111.content:
Erik stopped dead in his tracks. In all his enthusiasm to sell newspapers, he hadn't given any thought to the neighborhood where he had been assigned. Now, standing in front of his mother's house, he realized exactly where he was. This wasn't his childhood home; it was the place his mother had moved when he had gone away to college and she and Erik's father had split up. He had only been there a couple of times for holidays when he was in school, but still couldn't believe that he didn't recognize it right away.

The last time he had seen or spoken to his mother was ten years ago. She partly blamed Erik for her divorce, and Erik had never really forgiven her for putting him in the middle of their marriage troubles. Visits became fewer and fewer, followed by the conversations, and soon years and years had passed without them speaking.

Now Erik was standing in front of her house. The lights were on and the familiar Chevy Impala was parked in the driveway. She was home.

What should he do? Should he knock on the door, or should he move on to the next house?
1111.title: His Mother's house who he hasn't seen i...

choices: There is something in the pond.
He sees a mysterious figure in the garden.
It suddenly becomes dark.
1112.content:
A beautiful roof top , pink walls and white curtains , smoking chimney and an air filled with the smell of chocolate cake, a garden full of roses and a pond beautified with a swan !!!

Oh My Lord!! Is this really there or am I just too happy to be day dreaming. This is exactly what I saw in my dreams 2 days back. Can this be true.
Or Let me pinch myself.

Ouch!!

"Hey who are you and what do you want?" said the watchman.

"Oh..I...I am just looking at this house."

"Well, I can see that very well. Don't you see the board, Trespassers will be prosecuted. "

"I am sorry. But I am a newspaper seller and wish to talk to the owner of the house." said the salesperson when he was finally back to reality.

"Well. You seem to be a good boy. Hold on while I will get the right person to talk to. "

While he is alone and having a revision of his dream, something happens.
1112.title: A house he saw in a dream

choices: The figure was his dead sister
The figure was one of his ancestors
11122.content:
I looked around the place. It looked like any other ordinary house except for the fact that it looked...girly. It was

pink and had roses and it also had a pond with a swan. You don't see that everyday.When I was sure no one

was looking I picked up a small pebble. I wanted to throw it at the pond if you didn't know that already. I was

aiming it at an angle where I could do it unnoticed, get it in and not hit the swan. The air went woosh as I threw

the pebble. It landed right where I wanted it to and caused beautiful ripples. That's when I saw something out of

the corner of my eye. I looked to see what it was but it was gone. I saw it again this time on the other side. I

turned around to see nothing...again. The next time I saw it it was a blur. I tried to make it out but it was

impossible. It soon disappeared again. I looked everywhere but I still couldn't see it. I walked in side the garden

to let's just say investigate. I walked around despite the fact that though not directly the watchman had told me

to stay where I was. I walked around the pond admiring the swan. Then I walked to the roses and smelled them

but I ended up getting a thorn stuck in my arm. That's when I saw it again. This time it was clear.
11122.title: A mysterious figure

choices: Once in, he saw a group of people hunched over a sheet of paper in a corner.
The inside was nothing like he ever expected...he was completely taken aback!
11123.content:
...which is strange..considering the fact that it's noontime.

However, when he looks up, he sees a big dark cloud gathering over the house..which has shunned the sunlight to a certain extent.

"The owner of the house has invited you inside" informs the watchman and opens the imposing iron gate with spikes at the top.

"Go straight up the gravel path and it would lead you to the house" growled the watchman, as if the owner had invited the boy against his wishes.

The boy thanked him and continued up the path as instructed, all the while wondering about the inmates of this beautiful, beautiful house.

In his thoughts, he could see the chandlers..the paintings..the woodwork...that one would generally associate with such a structure and it made him a bit nervous.

"Please come in!" He heard the voice before he actually saw the maid.

The maid? Why on earth did he think that the girl standing in front of him was a "maid"?

Surely, there was nothing that could be made from the way she was dressed. Then, what was it?

He looked at her face...again.

Aha...there it was. She looked so...so...ordinary. No one living in such a palatial home can look so ordinary..so simple, he reasoned.

"Please come in." She repeated.

"T..Thank you!" he managed to stutter and followed her in.
11123.title: It suddenly becomes dark.

choices: Freak out
Play cool
Run into her house
1113.content: AHH! It's Drumbumb! The most famous actress EVA! You decide to knock on the door. She comes to answer it and you feel so great! Then you see her. In person. So excited...
1113.title: A famous celebrity's house

choices: Wise up and sell your newspapers.
Keep freaking out and tell her how you two are soul mates.
11131.content:
"Oh my God!" You shriek in excitement. "Eva! I can't believe it's actually you!"

She looks you over, standing there in a respectable suit with a respectable briefcase of wares to sell, screaming and fawning over her like one of her pre-teen girl fans at a concert.

"Uh, can I help you?" She asks, trying to be polite, but clearly uncomfortable with the situation. She looks like she wants to get rid of you as quickly as possible.

You're conflicted now. On the one hand, you have a job to do, and you know that the smarter, more adult thing to do would be to get control of yourself and do your job. Sell your newspapers and move on down the street. But the other part of you, the super-fan with the Eva posters on your wall at home and the Eva collectible merchandise and memorabilia scattered all around your apartment, wants to scream and cry and fall down on your knees and her feet and worship her for the talented musician/entertainer goddess that you know she is.

Which part of you wins out?
11131.title: Freak out

choices: Run into the master bedroom.
Make a quick getaway.
11133.content:
You immediately shove past Drumbumb and move into her house.

"My lord," you marvel as you look at the opulent mansion sprawling out in front of you. "It's just like I always dreamed it would be!"

"Listen, creeper," she snaps at you. "You really need to get the hell out of my house before I call the cops. I moved to this quiet neighborhood to get away from jerks like you."

You ignore her as you continue to move through the house, staring in awe at everything around you. Off in one corner of the ground floor, you see an open door leading to the master bedroom. This is where she sleeps! Where she gets dressed! Imagine how amazing it would be to actually be inside that room where she spends all her time!

As you debate whether to move down the hall, you hear her dialing a familiar three-digit number into her phone.

"Hello, police? It's happened again."

You probably don't have a lot of time left. What do you do?
11133.title: Run into her house

113.content:
“Marvelous simply marvelous…how is this possible! Certainly, sign me up. Will all the papers be like this one...?“

This is the normal response you get from your customers. You are top salesman in this first month you have been selling. You wonder how you had been so lucky to have stumbled across this particular paper company. You hope you aren’t just in a dream state.

The paper is special and when an individual reads some of the paper they find at least one article about their close friends or relatives. It is very strange, you realize, but who are you to question the results of your sales. Everyone is interested in reading about people they know.

You go to the office where you signed up to sell the paper. You don’t find anyone around. The printing presses are quiet. You walk around and there is no one there. You wonder what is going on. You visit the building every once in a while over the next few day and it’s always the same. This can’t be right, you decide.

You figure out that this paper is a magic paper and it caters to the will and wishes or its readers. You are concerned that maybe you should stop selling it but you know it brings a certain degree of happiness into the lives of your customers, so you believe it is something of a kindness you are participating in. You go on selling the paper because you like making others happy. It makes you a good living and you like the work.
113.title: It gives each individual reader news about thei...

choices: Your Soul
Your Loyalty
Your Undying Gratitude
115.content:
"Why... this paper is all about me!" the lady says. "It even has my name on it! The Martha Tidsdale News!"

"Yes, ma'am!" you say with a happy grin, knowing that everybody likes to read about themselves.

"And every day I get a new paper all about me?"

"Yes, ma'am. All the news about you that's fit to print."

She smiles. "Well, that sounds like a wonderful arrangement. Put me down as a new subscriber. Have any of my neighbors subscribed?"

"Yes, ma'am. All of them have."

"Really? Who would think they would all be interested in me?"

"Uh... their papers are about them. Only yours is about you."

"Oh. I see... Hmmmm... But I already know about me, don't I? Do I need to read it in a newspaper?"

"You can send the paper to friends and relatives?"

"Oh, that's true! OK, put me down for a subscription. How much is it?"

You always feel bad about this part, where you tell them the price. "The cost will be _____"
115.title: All About Me?!

121.content:
"Hello? Anybody home?" Erik yelled at the wooden door not really expecting an answer.

*sigh* He could hear the TV being turned down and he angrily thought 'How original people..let's just all pretend we are not home'

"Fine! Your loss" he shouted while kicking a flower pot to his left that he'd been eyeing while waiting. Panic suddenly replaced the look of satisfaction Erik was flaunting as he realized he had kicked the pot a bit harder than he expected. The flower pot tilted over crashing into a pile of rubble next to the door mat.

Erik quickly bent down and tried to recover the pieces. After two seconds he gave up and started looking around for a place to hide the mess. As he went to look away to scan the front yard something shiny caught his attention. He looked closely at the rubble on the doorstep and realized that something shiny was a key.

'Hmm' he thought 'Could this be the key to the 'empty' house before him?

123122.content:
Trying to act like this happens to you every day, you coolly stride towards the pool...and promptly trip over an odd little statue, one among many that surrounds the water. Your face smashes into the sandstone poolside surface.

"Ouch," you moan to yourself. Then you notice that she still isn't paying attention to you. Maybe she didn't see you! Confidence renewed, you rise to your feet, ignoring the pain arcing through your flattened face, and recommence your walk towards the pool.

Head still spinning, your vision has been thrown temporarily out of whack, and you misjudge the distance, marching straight into the pool like you were walking a pirate plank. Great. Now you're banged up AND soaked.

Maybe you should just give up...

Could you take them and fight?

13.content:
Everyone I ever worked with said that I should be in sales. My friend Eddy said it was because I am so full of shit. If that is true, then it is fitting that I should sell cleaning products. Of course, I could not tell them that I have become a slippery soap salesman out of embarassment. Maybe I shouldn't think that way. After all, I could become the greatest salesman in the states! Unseating Billy Mayes would be a defining moment in my career.
Sitting here talking won't get me there, so i better get to work.

-You have arrived at the first house in a typical suburban neighborhood. How will you handle your first prospective customer?
13.title: Cleaning Products: The dirty side to success

choices: Continue on with your story
Ask to come in
131.content:
You glance at the doorbell and take a deep breath. You can do this, you are a people person. You ring the doorbell, straighten your tie and put on a big grin. The door is answered by a little boy wearing a tinkerbell outfit, with lip gloss smeard on his face and hands. You look at him confused, and thne sputter out "Is your mother home?"
The boy looks at you for a moment, sruveying you up and down and then runs away to the back of the house, out of view. He comes running back just a few minutes later, with a large, messy looking woman trailing behind him. After seeing you standing at the doorway, she fixes her hair and wipes the chocolate from the corners of her mouth.
"Why hello there," she says, attempting a flirtacious smile. Her attempt almost made you laugh, but you stand straight and offer her your best smile. "Hello Miss, long day?" You ask with a friendly tone. She sighs and nods her head. "Well let me just say, I understand how you feel, I have two little ones of my own back home." Not knowing where to start you begin to talk about your own home. "And nothing soothes my wife like a clean smelling house at the end of the night, after all the kids have gone to bed..."
131.title: Ring the Doorbell

choices: Demonstrate the Cleaning Products
Demand She Pay for New Slacks
Storm From the House
1312.content:
You shiver in the rain as you continue to spin your golden bullshit, and she interrupts after a minute - fluttering her lashes before inviting you in. You blink, gulp and force yourself to accept with a 'Thank you, Ma'am.'

"Oh, Jennifer, please, call me Jennifer." She murmurs, holding your eyes as you step inside. The little boy tugs at the woman's sleeve. When she looks down, he says,

"But your name isn't Jennifer, Mommy..." She shushes him and gives him lipstick to play with. He happily smears it across his nose as he looks between you and his mother.

"Umm... as I was saying - "

"You shouldn't talk without tea! Come in, have a bit of tea."

"No, really, that's - "

"We have Earl Grey, and I think we might have a bag or two of that nice raspberry from when Janice stayed, but if we do its been sitting out a while and I think the cat may have licked 'em a few times, I'm sure they're still good though, they're quite hardy them tea-bags - "

"Really, Jennifer, it's fine. Thank you very much for the offer."

"Oh, it's nothing. Just didn't want a fine young man like yourself going thirsty, is all." She blushes, and you feel nauseous. Dear God, she better buy something.

You are just reaching into your briefcase to offer her a pamphlet when you feel a wetness on the back of your right thigh. You look down with dread, and see that the little boy has poured pink glitter-glue all over your slacks. All over your new slacks.

Jennifer sees and her eyes widen. She ushers him away, repeating 'sorry, sorry, so sorry' over and again as she pushes him from the room.

Finally, she turns to you and smiles hopefully. "Guess this'll give you a chance to demonstrate those cleaning products, huh?"
1312.title: Tinkerbell's Lair

choices: The third grade bully who used to give you wedgies
Your math teacher

132.title: Knock Knock

choices: Ask him if you can come in
Laugh at him and tell him who you are

1321.content:
....Paul! Paul Gregson, the mean, fat little boy who used to bully you at school. Your eyes smart at the painful memory of those wedgies in the changing rooms...but wait....

Paul looks tired, and he's fat now too. Behind him a baby screams, and two toddlers fight in the hallway. He stars at you, clearly not remembering who you are.

"Sir," you begin, "Could I interest you in...."

Your voice is cut off by a guttural shriek;

"Paul? Who is it, get in here and help me with the kids!" You old nemesis sighs and beings to turn away....
1321.title: The third grade bully who used to give you wedgies

choices: The snotty nosed kid bites your leg.
You forgo this address and leave rather abruptly.
You decide to give her a demo when she invites you in.
1322.content:
You recognize the person at the door as your math teacher from fifth seventh grade. You say, “Hi, I’m in your neighborhood knocking on a few doors, Mr. Gus, and because you answered your door I have a great gift for you.”

“Jeff isn’t it? I thought you looked familiar. So, you are out here working, are you? I was just about to start me an egg or two for breakfast. You, hungry? I have plenty; I could use the company right now.”

You hesitate, and then you remember you didn’t take the time to grab a bite to eat before you headed out the door. You didn’t feel hungry at the time. This is your first day and your stomach was a bit agitated. But now you are ravenous.

“Thanks, Mr. Gus, I believe I will join you.”

You eat your eggs and toast, without bacon, and have juice and coffee to drink. Mr. Gus waits to talk with you until you are finished chewing your meal. Mr. Gus knows it’s not nice to interrupt others while they are enjoying a meal.

“You see, Jeff, my wife just died last month and I’m having a terrible time adjusting. I get so lonely to talk to someone. I find myself sleeping late and the house is going to ruin. I have no motivation. I enjoy just being with another human being like this. I hope you understand.”

“Oh, yes, sir, I do understand. I don’t know how I would react to the death of someone I loved, but I can imagine it would be pretty lonely and sad. You did the right thing by asking me in. I was wondering though if you have ever thought of going to the local community center. I know they have luncheons week days for a small fee and they help you have others to talk with. My grandma went with grandpa before he died. They seemed happy with it. Now my grandma goes every time she feels well enough.”

“Yes, I have thought about it but that is as far as it has ever gone.”

“My mom takes my grandma and gets her again when she is ready to come home. You are right on the way and within walking distance if you need encouragement to take that first step. If you are not ready to come home when Grandma is you can always stay and walk home later. How does that sound, Mr. Gus?”

“Yes, that sounds like something I might try. It would be better if I could go with someone the first couple of times. Sort of break the ice, you might say. I’m really glad you came in and had breakfast with me, young man. This has been very enlightening. Thanks.”

You decide to not mention the product because you don’t want to burden the teacher after learning about his misfortune of losing his wife. You grab your demo kit and head for the door. “Thanks so much for the nice breakfast,” you pat your tummy and say, “filling. Thanks again It has been nice.”

“You get a late start after that interruption, but you feel much better for having helped another individual in their struggle in life. You put on a nice grin and go next door and give a rap on their door hoping they also ask you in; this time you want a demo from them not a meal and a visit.”

A snotty nosed kid answers the door; a sloppily dressed women looking like the mom type, trailed right behind him. She toted a toddler on one hip and sprouted a cigarette from her puffy lips; the cigarette wasn’t lit. Her hair was up in a wrap but it had escaped its confinement enough so that you can see it’s a dull yellow red color.

You don’t mean to stare but can’t help it. You swallow hard and start to turn away saying you have a wrong address…
1322.title: Your math teacher

choices: You decide to eat a bar
You decide not to eat the bar
14.content: You decided to sell chocolates, you love them. When you receive the box full of chocolate bars you can only think on the holy flavor of chocolate, you are addicted to them, you just can't live without them. When you decide to begin selling the chocolate you take a chocolate bar, you smell it and feel that if you eat just a little bit you'll eat your whole box (with 50 bars). What can you do, you're a hungry 12 years old boy, but you know yourself you'll eat one then 10 and then you'll keep the other bars...
14.title: Chocolate

choices: Look through the classifieds and see if there is a lawn job.
Trick mom into giving you money.
Set up your own business.
141.content:
In spite of your best intentions, you eat the chocolate bar. A single bar is only a dollar, right?

You think about this a minute as you finish the bar and your monstrous chocolate craving begins to permeate into your brain. You have fifteen dollars in your wallet leftover from your birthday present form Auntie Jane. That means you have up to fifteen candy bars for the taking! What's one more going to hurt?

Excited by your realization, you start eating your second candy bar. Two turns into five. Five turns into fifteen. Fifteen quickly turns into thirty. Before you know it, your hypothesis about your ravenous chocolate addiction turns to reality as you are left with only an empty box and a tummy ache.

What are you going to do now? You have to come up with thirty-five dollars by the end of the week; that's no easy feat for a twelve-year-old.

How are you going to do it?
141.title: You decide to eat a bar

choices: Call the number to ask about the job and the "catch"
Call and accept the job regardless--seventy-five dollars, here we come!
Move on to something else less...strange.
1411.content:
You think through your options for a moment. It's possible to start your own amateur business, but the only things you can think of sell are food and drink--a market that has already proven troublesome for your little gluttonous self. You consider tricking your mom into handing the cash. The idea is quickly dropped as soon as you remember the last time you tried to trick your mom. You're still scraping Yak off of your math book from that little misadventure

After careful evaluation, you decide that getting a job of your own--fast--is your best chance of getting out of this jam. You look through the classifieds to see if there is a lawn job somewhere or any other job that is qualified for a twelve-year old. Not much is offered, since you must be at least fifteen to work at any of the burger joints in the neighborhood, but you did find something that was promising.

In one ad the job is a weekend deal raking the fall leaves for what sounds like an elderly lady for a seventy-five dollar payday. However, the ad ends with "but there's a catch". Apparently, the lady didn't want to fork the cash for a longer ad.

The ad sounded strange, but seventy-five dollars is seventy-five dollars. Think of what you can do with an extra forty bucks. The least you can do is call about the job and see what this "catch" is and decline if it's too...too horrid.

What are you going to do?
1411.title: Look through the classifieds and see if there i...

choices: You quit the leaf raking job after you pay for the chocolates.
The manager agrees to let you sell chocolate bars to the customers.
14111.content:
You call the ad; a young man answers. You explain that you are interested in the raking job. You ask what the catch is. The young man said that he would like to meet you and would you please come to the address he provided.

You tell him you would be glad to come. When you arrive you find it is a golf course at the address he gave you. You go to the office inside the building. The manager talks to you and you find out you will be working to keep the leaves off the golf course.

You think this might be a job you could learn to like. You tell him that you would like to work for him during the summer months. He takes you around the course to view how extensive your job is. This course has more trees than any property you have ever seen.

You still want the job. He takes your information and you leave. The catch you figure is you get paid if you are still alive after a week of work in this golf course. You hope you survive.
14111.title: Call the number to ask about the job and the ...

You decided to steal the money from your older sister. So, you sneak up the stairs which seem to creak louder then ever. Your sister's door is open just a smidge but your not worried about her catching you beause you know she is at her band practise. You open the door and walk in. You have never been into your siser's room before wihout her permisson. Your palms are getting sweaty and your starting to have second thoughts. You eye happense to catch a gleam over by her desk. You walk closer to examin it and realize it is a chocolate bar wrapper. Thinking that she must have some more stashed in her room, you begin t search. Your caving is calling and the money has long left your mind
         An hour later you are sitting on the foot of her bed, chocolate-less. You sigh in frustration...on the verge of forfeit when you see a light from the corner of your eye. You turn to see her closet door. You stand up with a small gleam of hope. You slowly walk over to the closet door...you put your hand on the knob and slowly open it. The light comes pouring out an you see.....

1413.content: You decide to build a roller coaster! Wow, I know that's a little BIG for a 12 yr old. But the sudden urge to ride a spinning crazy roller coaster was almost as bad as the chocolate incident. You get started by designing it.
1413.title: Crazy.

choices: Grandma has come home, and screamed when she saw what you had done to the house.
Fuzzy the cat died
14132.content:
You decide to build the scariest roller coaster in the whole world. The only problem is, You've never built anything before! You don't even know anyone who has built anything before! So you decide to turn your grandma's house into a haunted house. She's at Thursday bridge, so you have two hours. You hang Fuzzy the cat on the ceiling, hoping he'll scratch the heads of visitors, and put all kinds of obstacles on the floor, like upturned chairs and marbles. You tape record yourself screaming and play it in the living room. All ready!

Just then, you hear a noise.
14132.title: The haunted house

choices: Ride the Roller Coaster
Wait to get it tested
14133.content: When you finally have the coaster all built and ready, you take one look at it and have a sudden urge to ride it. But there's something in the back of your mind reminding you that it has not yet been tested to be safe. What will you do next?
14133.title: Thrillin-coaster

choices: Climb down yourself.
Call 911
141331.content:
You decide, what the heck? I'm only 100 pounds. What's the worst that could happen?

So you hop into a seat and press the button to make you go up the first hill. Has you reach the top of the first hill, your adrenaline starts to rush. You scream with joy as the car plummets to the ground, and you smile with anticipation as you approach the first loop. When you reach the top of the loop, the car suddenly slows to a stop.

Uh oh! You're stuck! You think about calling 911 with your phone, but that would take a while, and you're starting to get a head ache from staying upside down for too long. You think about the other quicker, yet much more dangerous option: Climbing down your self. What will you do next?
141331.title: Ride the Roller Coaster

142.content:
So after an extreme act of will power, you come up with a great idea to get rid of all 50 bars in a big hurry, thus making good profits, and eliminating the temptation to eat the profits instead.
You proceed directly to the Sunset Towers Old Folks Home, where you happen to know everyone there just dotes on chocolate, almost as much as you do. What's more, you happen to know (through your aged aunt) that they're all extremely chocolate-deprived, because most of the inmates happen to be diabetic, and the staff won't allow them sweets.

On your way in the front door of the place, you make sure all the chocolate bars are well-hidden in your backpack. At this point:
142.title: You decide not to eat the bar

or the trailer park

"Ok, sure, if you dont sell to diabetics." You cheer in your head. Natsumi buys $10.00 worth and , luckily, none of your customers were diabetic. You sell a bit more, then leave. You can either go to a ritzy cul-de-sac or the trailer park next. Do you go to...
14233.title: bribe the nurse to keep quite and continue sell...

choices: the woman tries to seduce you
the woman tries to steal your chocolate
142332.content:
With a few more dollars and a few less chocolate bars, I headed to the trailer park. I figured that after starving pensioners, trailer-trash jerry springer fans were probably the best candidates for consumerism.
I stopped at a promising off-white trailer with a shattered window, patched up with a sheet of card. There were some small steps leading to a screen covered in bug debris. I grimaced before rapping three times. I stepped back. The air was heavy with a fug of chip fat and I could hear a television blaring from inside the house. Needless to say, it was a chatshow. A dog barked ferociously and I heard a thud as someone rolled off a sofa. A large woman appeared at the door. Out of her mouth hung an old cigarette. She was carrying an ugly-looking baby on her hip and she didn't speak, but barked.
"Whatever you're sellin', I ain't buyin'. Do I look like I gots the money fo' your crap?" I recoiled nervously.
"Er...um...chocolate," I mumbled. She watched me curiously.
"Get in here, boy!" She suddenly opened the screen and pulled me up the old steps.
142332.title: or the trailer park

choices: Dont drink it.
Drink it!
1423321.content:
Bad things, VERY bad things crossed your mind at this point. This kind of situation was one of the things youre supposed to avoid, isnt it? You recall one of the major rules at the school sales meeting being 'Never EVER enter a stranger's home. Sell at the door and ONLY at the door!' But the grip of the woman's hand was very strong and you dare not try to do anything that'll piss her off. Plus... the way her baby's big red eyes were staring into your soul scared the beejebus outta you!

"Have a seat!" she practically orders you the moment she lets go of your hand. You complied and sat down on the big soft sofa, gripping your box of chocolates tight. "Wait right there. I'm gonna put little Joey to bed." She left toward the other room with her ugly baby still staring back at you along the way.

And so there you were. All alone in the living room of that big scary trailer... you could still hear that stupid dog barking outside. To pass the time, you looked over all the pictures hung along the walls. Mostly pictures of motorcycles. Harley-Davidsons if you had to assume. A couple of pictures of big sweaty hairy guys riding on motorcycles and pickup-trucks as well.... Yep... definitely trailer-trash material.

Although there were a few that kinda caught your eye. The ones that had the picture of the same beautiful young woman that looked somewhat familiar to you. One was of her posing in front of a big Chevy with her back turned wearing a cut-up top and daisy-duke shorts, one had her riding in the back of a motorcycle with some fat bearded dude in the front, one looked like a marriage photo with her in a silky white bridal gown with a rather slim tall blonde guy as the groom, and another of her french kissing another woman in a darkened bar (that's right. I said WOMAN!)... Looks like somebody had the time of her life.

Hmm... you know something? She kinda looks like the woman who 'politely' invited you into her home! That must be her from years ago! Sure, you gotta admit she didnt quite age badly, but..

"Sorry about going off on you like that earlier," you overheard her calling to you, "just got out of prison a month ago." ...Goody... "Been there for about 10 years cuz of some b.s. charge I kinda forgot about! Got awfully lonely since then. You know how long it's been since I felt the touch of a man?!" Oh dear.
"Uh... um..." this talk was probably NOT something a kid like you is used to, "...uh... 10 years?"

"NO!" she shouted at you from the other room, "it's been about 10 years and 52 days!" You could hear her blowing smoke from her cigarette in the other room. "Hope you dont mind hanging out with such a lonely old gal like myself, little boy." She finally came back into the livingroom... carrying a big bottle of tequila in her hand. Now youre REALLY sure your school sales meeting warned you about this kind of situation!

She sat down REALLY close to you on that couch! "Y..y...y...youre not old at all!" you stuttered as you gripped your box of chocolates even tighter!
"Aw... arent you sweet?" she grinned at you before taking a BIG swig of her tequila! The strong smell coming from that bottle almost burnt your nostrils! "*Urp!* Want some?"

"N...no thanks," you answered, "I'm underage."
"So?" she simply remarked, "youre a man, aintcha?! I'm sure a cute little man like you can take it!"
"B-B-B-but...."

"K, how's 'bout this?" she then gave you a huge offer, "if you man up and drink a sip of this stuff... I'll buy that whole box off ya! What do you say?" She'll buy the WHOLE box of chocolates if you'll just drink a sip of her tequila?! Awesome! But... it looks like some pretty strong stuff. It's smell could knock you out... imagine what it's taste could do!

"C'mon, boy! You a real man? ...Or a little wuss?"
1423321.title: Momma always said never talk to strangers

info.brief_description: Imanige all the adventures you'll have as a door to door salesman
info.description: Basically this is just a fun little story about being a door to door salesperson. P.S Thanks to whoever is sponsering this item.
